results.title: Prevalence and Prognosis of Atenolol-Responsive Systolic Anterior Motion of the Septal Mitral Valve Leaflet in Young Cats with Severe Dynamic Left Ventricular Outflow Tract Obstruction
results.text_hl: One of them was 1.5 years old and 6 months after the starting the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ therapy, and the other @SPECIES_9685 @@@cat@@@ was 7 years old and 5.5 years after initiation of the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ therapy.

results.title: Beta-blockade and exercise capacity in patients with mitral stenosis in sinus rhythm.
authors: García de Burgos de Rico E
results.text_hl: BACKGROUND AND AIM OF THE STUDY: The study aim was to determine whether beta-blocker treatment (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@) improves cardiopulmonary exercise performance and ventilatory response in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Mitral_Valve_Stenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008946 @@@mitral stenosis@@@ in sinus rhythm.

citations.NLM: Monmeneu Menadas JV, Marín Ortuño F, Reyes Gomis F, Jordán Torrent A, García Martínez M, Bodí Peris V, García de Burgos de Rico E. Beta-blockade and exercise capacity in patients with mitral stenosis in sinus rhythm. J Heart Valve Dis. 2002 Mar;11(2):199-203. PMID: 12000160

results.title: Beta-adrenergic receptor blockade in the management of pregnant women with mitral stenosis.
results.text_hl: Twenty-five pregnant @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with symptomatic @<m>DISEASE_Mitral_Valve_Stenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008946 @@@mitral valve stenosis@@@ (mean valve area, 1.1 +/- 0.25 cm2) were managed by initiation or modification of beta-adrenergic receptor blockade with the use of either @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: al Kasab SM, Sabag T, al Zaibag M, Awaad M, al Bitar I, Halim MA, Abdullah MA, Shahed M, Rajendran V, Sawyer W. Beta-adrenergic receptor blockade in the management of pregnant women with mitral stenosis. Am J Obstet Gynecol. 1990 Jul;163(1 Pt 1):37-40. PMID: 1973871

results.title: Beta adrenergic blockade does not improve effort tolerance in patients with mitral stenosis in sinus rhythm.
results.text_hl: METHODS: Nineteen @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with isolated symptomatic (New York Heart Association class II or III) @<m>DISEASE_Mitral_Valve_Stenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008946 @@@mitral stenosis@@@ received a beta-blocker (acebutalol or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@) or matching placebo for one week each in a randomized double-blind crossover fashion.

citations.NLM: Patel JJ, Dyer RB, Mitha AS. Beta adrenergic blockade does not improve effort tolerance in patients with mitral stenosis in sinus rhythm. Eur Heart J. 1995 Sep;16(9):1264-8. PMID: 8582390
citations.BibTeX: @article{8582390, title={Beta adrenergic blockade does not improve effort tolerance in patients with mitral stenosis in sinus rhythm.}, author={Patel JJ and Dyer RB and Mitha AS}, journal={Eur Heart J}, volume={16}, number={9}, pages={1264-8}}
